summary: The Food and Veterinary Office (FVO) is an integral part of the European Union's regulatory framework, operating under the auspices of the European Commission. Its primary mandate is to ensure compliance with EU legislation concerning food safety and animal health. The FVO conducts inspections and audits in member states and third countries, assessing adherence to veterinary and phytosanitary standards. By promoting harmonization of food safety regulations, the FVO plays a crucial role in safeguarding public health and ensuring consumer protection across the EU. Its activities are vital for maintaining the integrity of the internal market and fostering trust in food products.
